name: High-Hankle
tagline: Ancient capital of the High Wold and burgeoning town of hedonism
description: An ancient, thriving town that has formed the heart of High Wold culture since days long since forgotten. At its centre, within the great town walls, the imposing baronial tower—Castle Perigonne—surveys the windswept grasslands and rolling hills of the southern High Wold.
atmosphere: A town of revelry, carousing, and debauchery of all kinds, now the favoured haunt of jaded nobles, hedonists, and thrill-seekers from far and wide
inhabitants_description: As a town of some renown, High-Hankle is home to a diverse population of local, curly-haired High Woldish folk, breggles, and a sizeable number of immigrants from throughout Dolmenwood and beyond. Approximately half the population dwells within the town walls and half without.

governance.ruling_body: Baron Hogwarsh rules over High-Hankle and the surrounding High Wold region
governance.political_status: The baron's disinterest in law and order has spurred a rapid waxing in the power of the thieves' guild
governance.notes: Spies are numerous within the courts of Castle Perigonne. The High Wold's longhorn noble houses have long envied the power of House Hogwarsh

religion.religious_practices: By and large, the folk of High-Hankle adhere to the tenets of the Pluritine Church, with the resplendent Three Martyrs Minster serving as their locus of worship. Led by the Baron's example, however, an irreligious mien is en vogue among the youthful aristocracy.
religion.notes: The Silent Tower is headquarters of the Order of St Signis the Silent

history: Ancient capital of the High Wold
Has formed the heart of High Wold culture since days long since forgotten
Since the current baron's ascent to power, High-Hankle's reputation is one of revelry, carousing, and debauchery
current_events: The thieves' guild has become a power to contend with under the baron's lax rule
Three griffons recently escaped from the Griffonry and are living wild, terrorising the surrounding farmland
Lord Ramius connives against the reckless Hogwarsh, wishing to be declared baron of the High Wold in his stead

special_features.name: Hangleton
special_features.description: Once a separate village that was gradually subsumed by the town, Hangleton is the name now given to all parts of High-Hankle that lie outside the town wall. It is here that the majority of the town's lower classes dwell, in a jumble of cottages, workshops, market squares, and drinking establishments.

special_features.name: The Escalade
special_features.description: A labyrinthine district of bridges, arches, and raised buildings built up over many centuries around the skirts of Castle Perigonne, at the centre of the town. The Escalade now consists of three stacked layers with stairways and ramps providing access to the upper and middle layers.

equipment_availability.notes: In addition to the standard equipment and services listed in the DPB, unusual, non-standard businesses can be located with a little investigative work.

locations.name: Castle Perigonne
locations.description: A massive, dizzyingly tall tower of stone that looms over High-Hankle. Its lower levels are now effectively subterranean, subsumed beneath the three layers of the Escalade.
locations.interior: Seemingly countless floors of luxurious suites, dusty libraries and map rooms, taxidermy-bedecked lounges, and opulent banquet halls. The castle's subdued tapestries and stately furnishings are rapidly being replaced with a modish array of gaudy oil paintings, silk upholstered couches, and garish carpets.
locations.exterior: A grand stair, lined with scowling griffon statues, leads from the upper layer of the Escalade to the black iron gates of the castle.
locations.populace: The Baron Hogwarsh, his doting mother, the Dowager Baroness, his timorous brother, Walter, and a staff of around 50 servants
special_features: Ancient granite gate in the bowels of the Escalade's lower layer, disused and magically sealed
secrets: Ancient gate could provide a means of escape from the castle in dire need

locations.name: The Griffonry
locations.description: The High-Hankle garrison—a squat keep with six crenellated towers, adjoining the lower levels of Castle Perigonne. The central courtyard is home to a herd of griffons—the pride of the barony.
locations.interior: Chilly stone chambers draped with heraldic flags, sombre banquet halls, cramped dormitories.
locations.exterior: A portcullis and massive door inlaid with the image of a griffon battling a unicorn.
locations.populace: 60 soldiers, led by the dashing Sir Waverly 'the Orange'
special_features: Seven griffons total, but only four currently resident
The beasts are sometimes seen flying above the garrison, reined with long chains of fairy silver
secrets: Three griffons recently escaped and are living wild, terrorising the surrounding farmland

locations.name: The Crown Cruciferous
locations.description: A lofty stone building perched upon the upper layer of the Escalade beside a grand stairway leading up from street level. The inn is styled after a cathedral, complete with small flying buttresses and stained glass windows.
locations.interior: A broad, reverberant stone hall, decked with plush green carpet. Booths around the perimeter, discreetly partitioned with wood panelling, contain upholstered seating and tables. The middle floor is dedicated to a dozen large private rooms, each sporting a fabulous stained glass window, as well as the inn's kitchens.
locations.exterior: A golden crown decorated with a hefty cross of rubies sign
locations.populace: Well-to-do merchants, intellectuals, priests, and the occasional aristocrat whose low rank or disfavour with the baron forces them to seek lodgings outside of Castle Perigonne

services.name: Rooms with a view
services.description: Exclusive private suites facing north-west, with a view over the Hangle Gate and the sweep of Tankards Road as it winds into the hills

special_features: Heraldic banners and the coats of arms of hundreds of obscure noble houses line the walls

locations.name: The Balustrade
locations.description: A tall, ungainly building clad with wooden tiles, spanning all three levels of the Escalade. One entrance at street level leads to the public tavern, while another atop the Escalade (upper layer) grants entrance to the ballroom.
locations.interior: Common room (ground floor): A dingy, maze-like space extending beneath the Escalade. Smoke and sweat pervade. Ballrooms (upper 2 floors): Scintillating crystal chandeliers, polished oak flooring, and billowing white drapes. Scantily clad, glitter-daubed staff serve drinks on trays.
locations.exterior: A miniature dragon coiled around a goblet, smoke meandering from its nostrils sign
locations.populace: The common room is frequented by a heaving mass of people from all walks of life, as young aesthetes daringly mingle with commoners. The ballrooms are peopled by lascivious young gentry and adventurers.

services.name: Golden aspintheon
services.description: 3-in-6 chance of the legendary tipple being available

services.name: Psychedelic compounds
services.description: 2-in-6 chance of each compound being available from a discreet vendor
services.notes: Azoth, Black Clover, Devil's Grease, Frisk, Goatman's Goblet, Witch's Purple

special_features: A marble balustrade leads up to the ballrooms
The resident, virtuoso string ensemble plays fashionable dance tunes late into the night
secrets: It is an open secret that the Balustrade is owned by Bagsley Corundum, master of thieves

locations.name: Hangle Gate
locations.description: Flanked on each side by a great stone boar, bearing the fluttering banners of House Nodlock and House Murkin. Atop the battlements stand two further boars, bearing the banners of House Ramius and House Malbleat (the latter boar of notably newer construction).
locations.populace: 2d4 soldiers of the town guard at any given time
special_features: Heraldic banners of the noble houses

locations.name: The Silent Tower
locations.description: A mighty sandstone tower carved with a multitude of gargoyles, overlooking the placid, yew-shaded avenues of the town's graveyard. This is the headquarters of the Order of St Signis the Silent in the Dolmenwood region.
locations.exterior: A stele-lined path leads through the graveyard to the tower's iron gates, engraved with litanies to St Signis
locations.populace: Joan Ablewright—commander of the Order of St Signis—along with 12 clerics of the Order
special_features: Carved with a multitude of gargoyles

locations.name: Griffon Gate
locations.description: A broad, deep gate flanked by statues of rearing griffons. Small windows indicate the presence of a set of rooms above the gate.
locations.interior: A locked door inside the gate leads up a narrow stair into the quarters of the Florid Envoy, including a cramped but extensive library on the lore of Fairy and its inhabitants.
locations.exterior: Flanked by statues of rearing griffons
locations.populace: 2d4 soldiers of the town guard at any given time, Gemrand Soliquant, the current Florid Envoy
special_features: Extensive library on the lore of Fairy and its inhabitants

locations.name: Battery Square
locations.description: A flagstoned square with a great bronze statue of a spear-pierced boar (the emblem of House Hogwarsh) at its centre.
locations.exterior: Great bronze statue of a spear-pierced boar at centre

services.name: Eggfast horse market
services.description: Once a week, on Eggfast, a dedicated horse market takes place. Renowned as the place to buy the finest steeds in all the duchy

special_features: An arsenal of venerable catapults and ballistas stands upon the battlements of the town wall, overlooking the square

locations.name: The Raven Tower
locations.description: An austere, windowless, hexagonal tower of sheer black stone, notorious throughout Dolmenwood. Dangerous convicts and political prisoners are confined before trial or execution in the many levels of dungeons, oubliettes, and interrogation chambers that extend beneath the tower.
locations.interior: Many levels of dungeons, oubliettes, and interrogation chambers that extend beneath the tower
locations.exterior: A mighty gate of solid iron, in Battery Square
locations.populace: A dedicated company of 20 soldiers of the town watch protects the Raven Tower

locations.name: Helmsmith's
locations.description: A bulky brick building whose chimney belches day and night. The resident smith, Griselda Helmsmith, is renowned as one of the finest armourers in the duchy.
locations.exterior: Bulky brick building with belching chimney

services.name: Standard armour
services.description: At 25% above the normal price. Stamped with Helmsmith's prestigious hallmark

services.name: Full plate armour
services.description: Helmsmith has the expertise to craft full plate armour

services.name: Engraving
services.description: Commissioned armour may be engraved with patterns, script, or runes, as the buyer wishes

special_features: Renowned as one of the finest armourers in the duchy

locations.name: Hankle Heirlooms
locations.description: A venerable timber-framed house, leaning to one side in its age. Affiliated with the High-Hankle thieves' guild, Hankle Heirlooms maintains a 'no questions asked' policy with regard to purchasing valuable items.
locations.interior: A series of creaky wooden rooms crammed with antique furniture, jewellery display cases, and taxidermied curios. A genteel quietude pervades.
locations.exterior: A serpent coiling around a distressed lamb sign
locations.populace: Snerd Furroughby pops out from an unexpected location, after observing visitors for a short while. 8 shorthorns armed with crossbows and longswords lurk in corners

services.name: Jewellery and antiquities
services.description: Stocks a wide range of high quality items

services.name: Fencing
services.description: The store purchases items that may arouse suspicion at 50% of their full value
services.notes: Fenced items are not on public display, but may be available to trusted customers

special_features: Affiliated with the High-Hankle thieves' guild

locations.name: Fettered Gate
locations.description: Flanked with two turrets, from which a multitude of thick, rusty chains hang. In olden times, the corpses of murderers and treasonists were hung from the chains to be devoured by crows.
locations.exterior: Two turrets with thick, rusty chains hanging from them
locations.populace: 2d4 soldiers of the town watch at any given time
secrets: In olden times, the corpses of murderers and treasonists were hung from the chains to be devoured by crows

locations.name: The Chantry
locations.description: A wide, wood-framed building with a multitude of odd-shaped windows and a beautifully maintained thatched roof. In former times, the Chantry only accepted clergy, but now functions as a normal travellers' inn.
locations.interior: An open plan space of three broad, connected rooms—each with its own hearth—occupying the inn's whole ground floor. A number of tables in odd corners are sequestered with thick curtains.
locations.exterior: A Chapes holy symbol ringed with holly sign
locations.populace: Travellers from all walks of life rub shoulders at the Chantry—the town's busiest inn

services.name: Evening poetry
services.description: From dinner time, bards stand before the inn's three hearths and regale patrons with epics, folktales, poems, and parables

locations.name: Three Martyrs Minster
locations.description: An ancient, blocky structure of crumbling sandstone with a square tower whose flat roof affords priests a view of the town. The minster's exterior is remarkable only for its utter lack of gargoyles and other ornamentation.
locations.interior: Contrasting its unadorned exterior, the minster's interior is a breathtaking vista of marble pillars and vaults, carved to resemble the fruit-laden boughs of an orchard. The chancel houses an unusual triumvirate of altars, dedicated to St Esther, St Hildace, and St Ingrid.
locations.exterior: Grand gates of weathered copper, engraved with a unicorn and cockatrice lounging in the shade of an apple tree
locations.populace: Awe-struck locals of the lower classes, officious priests on upper balconies quietly convening with the archdeacon, Adreline Sumner

services.name: Prayer
services.description: Characters praying may receive the blessing of one of the three martyrs: the ability to cast Aid (St Esther), Command (St Ingrid), or Sanctuary (St Hildace)
services.notes: See Shrines, p22 and Uncommon Spells, p454

special_features: Triumvirate of altars dedicated to St Esther, St Hildace, and St Ingrid
secrets: The symbolism of the entrance engraving is mysterious

locations.name: Coldlanks
locations.description: A teetering, three storey wooden building whose small windows constantly emit the stench of pipesmoke.
locations.interior: A bustling space extending the full height of the building's three storeys. A rickety stairway spirals up, giving access to bowing balconies held up by makeshift beams and ropes.
locations.exterior: A weeping cat's face, surrounded by sliced onions sign

services.name: Coldlanks
services.description: The raw grated onion dish. Classic coldlanks (marinated in mustard and beer) costs 2sp. Variant specialities (marinated in wine, mixed with horseradish, fried with bacon, fermented and smoked) cost 3sp
services.notes: The tavern serves no food aside from its namesake

special_features: Musicians and fire jugglers enhance the raucous din, of an evening

locations.name: South Road
locations.description: A broad, paved road that connects High-Hankle with the regions of the High Wold to the south.

locations.name: Swallop Road
locations.description: A hedge-lined country road that winds through rustic farmland towards Lankshorn.

locations.name: Tankards Road
locations.description: A steep road that traverses a series of hilly ridges toward the Inn of the Tankards (hex 0511) and Lord Ramius' realm.

npcs.name: Sir Hoarsent Waverly "the Orange"
npcs.title: Level 10 Knight
npcs.description: A slim, freckled, clean-shaven human man of 40 years, with cascading orange curls and striking green eyes.
npcs.dress: Dresses in shining, orange-crested plate or (when off duty) in orange doublet and fashionable neck ruff
desires: The baron's heart (despite Hoarsent's well-known dalliances with noblemen and academics, he loves Hogwarsh)
The return of the wayward griffons
secrets: Loves Baron Hogwarsh despite his well-known dalliances with noblemen and academics

known_topics.content: Sir Waverly flashes a rakish grin. 'The Griffonry houses seven magnificent beasts—though only four reside here currently. They are the pride of the barony, reined with chains of fairy silver.'
His expression darkens. 'Three griffons escaped recently. They're living wild now, terrorising the surrounding farmland. I must recapture them.'
He straightens proudly. 'Sixty soldiers under my command. We protect High-Hankle and serve Baron Hogwarsh faithfully.'

secret_info.content: His eyes soften unexpectedly. 'Despite my... dalliances with noblemen and academics, there is only one I truly love. The Baron himself. Though he seems oblivious to my feelings.'
secret_info.hint: He becomes flustered when discussing the Baron directly.

relationships.notes: Waverly loves Hogwarsh despite the baron's seeming obliviousness

faction_hooks.description: Hunt down and return the three escaped griffons terrorising the farmlands

npcs.name: Emeritus Jasquith
npcs.title: Crown Cruciferous Proprietor
npcs.description: A looming, portly human man in his late middle years, with impeccably greased hair, drooping jowls, and a brass-rimmed monocle.
npcs.dress: Dresses in a pristine dinner jacket and bow tie
desires: The finest wine selection in the duchy
Relics of St Howarth the Accursed, especially his hand, purported to be in the sunken ruins of Lankston (hex 0610)
secrets: Before taking over the Crown Cruciferous from his father, Emeritus was a monk at the Refuge of St Keye (hex 1307)

known_topics.content: Jasquith adjusts his monocle with slow precision. 'The Crown Cruciferous offers lodgings and food of fancy quality. Rooms with a view—overlooking the Hangle Gate—cost twenty-five gold per night.'
His eyes gleam. 'I seek the finest wine selection in the duchy. If you encounter rare vintages in your travels, I pay generously.'
He leans forward conspiratorially. 'I collect relics of St Howarth the Accursed. Especially his hand—purported to be in the sunken ruins of Lankston, in hex 0610.'

secret_info.content: Jasquith rumbles indignantly. 'Before inheriting this establishment, I was a monk at the Refuge of St Keye, in hex 1307. A... different life. I prefer not to speak of it.'
secret_info.hint: He knows Liturgic and has an unusually devout bearing for an innkeeper.

npcs.name: Bagsley Corundum
npcs.title: Thieves' Guildmaster (Level 11 Thief)
npcs.description: A slight, middle-aged human man, blind in one eye, his face disfigured by burn scars.
npcs.dress: Dresses in drab silks, with his face concealed within a voluminous hood
npcs.mannerisms: Traces his fingers over his facial scars when in thought
desires: To wed his daughter Jacinth to Baron Hogwarsh, cementing his power over High-Hankle and the High Wold
secrets: Has 4 unfailingly loyal bodyguard-lieutenants, 60 relatively loyal guild members

known_topics.content: Corundum traces his burn scars thoughtfully. 'The Balustrade offers entertainment for all classes. The common room below, the ballrooms above. Entry to the ballrooms costs five gold per person.'
His voice is quiet yet brutal. 'Golden aspintheon—the legendary tipple. Three-in-six chance we have it in stock. Psychedelic compounds are also available... from discreet vendors.'

secret_info.content: He leans close, his disfigured face half-hidden in his hood. 'I am Bagsley Corundum, master of the thieves' guild. I have four unfailingly loyal lieutenants and sixty guild members. The baron's lax rule has been... profitable.'
secret_info.hint: It is an open secret that he owns the Balustrade.

secret_info.content: His tactical mind turns to scheming. 'My daughter Jacinth is beautiful and refined. If I could wed her to Baron Hogwarsh, my power over High-Hankle and the High Wold would be complete.'
secret_info.hint: He seems unusually interested in the baron's marital status.

relationships.description: Seeks to marry his daughter to the baron to cement power
relationships.notes: Corundum's thieves' guild has grown powerful under the baron's lax rule

relationships.description: Hankle Heirlooms is affiliated with the thieves' guild

faction_hooks.description: Discreet work for the thieves' guild—burglary, intimidation, information gathering

npcs.name: Gemrand Soliquant
npcs.title: The Florid Envoy (Sage)
npcs.description: A tall, flabby, middle-aged human man with wavy blond hair, wide, green eyes, and thin, wafting moustaches.
npcs.dress: Dresses in dusty russet robes with a profusion of silver bangles, earrings, and medallions
npcs.mannerisms: Believes fairies to be superior to mortals in all respects
npcs.speech: Rich, effusive, strays between topics. Woldish, Old Woldish, Sylvan, rudimentary High Elfish.
desires: Fairy artefacts—he has a budget of 1,000gp
Word of any lingering fairy presence in Hoarblight Keep (hex 0505) or the Cold Prince's embassy (hex 0504)
Secretly wishes for the Cold Prince to return to Dolmenwood, and would collude to bring this about
secrets: Secretly wishes for the Cold Prince to return to Dolmenwood, and would collude to bring this about
npcs.occupation: Sage specialising in the study of Fairy

known_topics.content: Soliquant's voice is rich and effusive. 'I am the Florid Envoy—the barony's official liaison with Fairy. My library above the Griffon Gate contains extensive lore on Fairy and its inhabitants.'
He jangles his profusion of silver bangles. 'I purchase fairy artefacts—I have a budget of one thousand gold pieces. Bring me curiosities from the fey realms and be well compensated.'

His eyes widen with irreverent enthusiasm. 'I seek word of any lingering fairy presence in Hoarblight Keep, hex 0505, or the Cold Prince's embassy in hex 0504. The Cold Prince's legacy fascinates me.'

secret_info.content: His voice drops to a whisper. 'I believe fairies are superior to mortals in all respects. And I... I secretly wish for the Cold Prince to return to Dolmenwood. If you could help bring this about, I would be most grateful.'
secret_info.hint: His enthusiasm for the Cold Prince seems unusually fervent.

faction_hooks.description: Aid in efforts to restore the Cold Prince's presence in Dolmenwood

npcs.name: Griselda Helmsmith
npcs.title: Helmsmith's Proprietor
npcs.description: A muscular human woman in her 40s, with a snub nose, freckles, and a cascade of wiry locks.
npcs.dress: Dresses in leather apron and trousers, baring the owl tattoos on her arms
npcs.mannerisms: Seldom allows someone to leave without a purchase
desires: Challenging commissions from the rich and powerful

known_topics.content: Griselda flexes her tattooed arms proudly. 'I am one of the finest armourers in the duchy. Standard armour at twenty-five percent above normal price—stamped with Helmsmith's prestigious hallmark.'
She grins. 'I have the expertise to craft full plate armour—a rare skill. Engraving with patterns, script, or runes typically doubles the cost.'
Her eyes light up. 'I seek rare metals—fairy silver, Hag Iron, anything unusual. Bring me such materials and I'll offer generous trade or commission discounts.'

npcs.name: Snerd Furroughby
npcs.title: Hankle Heirlooms Proprietor
npcs.description: A mature longhorn gentleman, 6½′ tall, with dappled chestnut fur and striking eyes of deep green.
npcs.dress: Dresses in dapper tweed and black velvet smoking jacket
npcs.speech: Smooth and sonorous. Woldish, Caprice, Gaffe.
desires: Loves mysterious treasure maps and codes
Obsessed with the legend of the lost hoard of Dewidort of Smerne, said to include the Hanglehorn—a lost heirloom of House Hogwarsh
secrets: Knows that Dewidort of Smerne magically hid his treasures inside solid rock. Suspects that his lost hoard is concealed within a standing stone somewhere in Dolmenwood
Is a distant cousin of Lord Ramius

known_topics.content: Furroughby's voice is smooth and sonorous. 'Hankle Heirlooms deals in jewellery and antiquities of the finest quality. Prices range from two hundred to five thousand gold.'
He twitches one eye slightly. 'We maintain a... no questions asked policy. Items that might arouse suspicion elsewhere can be sold here at fifty percent of their value.'
His eyes gleam. 'I adore mysterious treasure maps and codes. Bring me such curiosities and we can negotiate a fair price—or a trade.'

secret_info.content: Furroughby leans close. 'I am obsessed with the legend of the lost hoard of Dewidort of Smerne—said to include the Hanglehorn, a lost heirloom of House Hogwarsh. Dewidort magically hid his treasures inside solid rock. I suspect his hoard is concealed within a standing stone somewhere in Dolmenwood.'
secret_info.hint: He shows unusual interest in standing stones and ancient legends.

secret_info.content: He adjusts his tweed jacket. 'I am a distant cousin of Lord Ramius. A useful connection, though one I keep quiet.'
secret_info.hint: His noble bearing seems unusual for a shopkeeper.

relationships.description: Hankle Heirlooms is affiliated with the thieves' guild
relationships.notes: Eight shorthorn guards armed with crossbows lurk in corners of the shop

relationships.description: Distant cousin of the longhorn noble

faction_hooks.description: Locate the standing stone containing Dewidort of Smerne's hidden treasure

npcs.name: Sandrine Candlewick
npcs.title: Chantry Proprietor
npcs.description: A stocky human woman in her 20s, with plaited red hair, ruddy cheeks, and aquiline nose.
npcs.dress: Dresses in a colourful, patchwork apron over frilly dresses
desires: To discover the location (believed to be somewhere in Dwelmfurgh) of the spiritual ascension of her ancestor, Abygail Grynn, and to petition the Church for her to be accepted into the host of saints
secrets: Recently took over the Chantry, following the death of her mother

known_topics.content: Sandrine speaks softly and deliberately. 'The Chantry offers lodging and food of common quality at standard price. In former times, we only accepted clergy, but now all travelers are welcome.'
She brightens slightly. 'From dinner time, bards stand before our three hearths and regale patrons with epics, folktales, poems, and parables. We are the town's busiest inn.'

Her ruddy cheeks flush with passion. 'My ancestor, Abygail Grynn, achieved spiritual ascension somewhere in Dwelmfurgh. I wish to discover the exact location and petition the Church to accept her into the host of saints.'

secret_info.content: Her eyes grow moist. 'I only recently took over the Chantry, following the death of my mother. It has been... difficult.'
secret_info.hint: She seems young and somewhat overwhelmed by her responsibilities.

npcs.name: Blinghop Drooglight
npcs.title: Coldlanks Proprietor
npcs.description: A lanky woodgrue woman in her middle years, with greying fur, weepy eyes, and bright orange ears.
npcs.mannerisms: Gleefully incites brawls and playful anarchy
npcs.speech: Hoarse babbling and cackling. Woldish, Sylvan.
desires: Establish a secret den beneath the Escalade
Liaisons with broad-minded fairies of all kinds

known_topics.content: Blinghop cackles hoarsely. 'Welcome to Coldlanks! We serve coldlanks—raw grated onion. Classic style marinated in mustard and beer costs two silver. Fancy variants cost three.'
She babbles gleefully. 'Musicians and fire jugglers enhance the raucous din of an evening! I may incite a brawl or two—keeps things lively!'

secret_info.content: She leans close, her bright orange ears twitching. 'I wish to establish a secret den beneath the Escalade. A private space for... special gatherings. Could use help clearing it out.'
secret_info.hint: She seems unusually interested in the lower levels of the Escalade.

secret_info.content: Her weepy eyes gleam mischievously. 'I seek liaisons with broad-minded fairies of all kinds. If you know any who might be... interested, send them my way.'
secret_info.hint: She shows particular warmth toward anyone with fairy blood.

npcs.name: Venerable Adreline Sumner
npcs.title: Archdeacon of High-Hankle
npcs.description: A slight human woman, of wan complexion and advancing years.
npcs.dress: Dresses in plain white robes, with silver hair in a long braid
desires: Private discourse with Abbot Hargle about Bishop Sanguine's waxing zealotry
secrets: The Archdeacon is utterly absorbed in Church matters, and knows little of High-Hankle's recent degeneration

known_topics.content: Venerable Adreline speaks in wavering tones. 'The Three Martyrs Minster honors St Esther, St Hildace, and St Ingrid. Those who pray may receive one of their blessings—Aid, Sanctuary, or Command.'
She grows contemplative. 'As Archdeacon of High-Hankle, I oversee Church matters in this region. It is a responsibility I take seriously.'

secret_info.content: She glances around fearfully. 'I desire private discourse with Abbot Hargle about Bishop Sanguine's waxing zealotry. The Bishop grows ever more extreme, and I fear where this path may lead.'
secret_info.hint: She seems troubled when Church politics are mentioned.

secret_info.content: She admits with embarrassment. 'I am utterly absorbed in Church matters. I confess I know little of High-Hankle's recent... degeneration under the Baron's rule.'
secret_info.hint: She seems oblivious to the town's moral decline.

relationships.description: Consults with the Order of St Signis on undead matters
relationships.notes: Sometimes marches to the Silent Tower at night to consult the Order

npcs.name: Joan Ablewright
npcs.title: Commander of the Order of St Signis

known_topics.content: Joan Ablewright speaks with quiet authority. 'The Silent Tower is headquarters of the Order of St Signis the Silent in Dolmenwood. Twelve clerics serve under my command, dedicated to combating the undead.'
Her expression grows grave. 'We have received rumours of an undead plague around the ruins of Lankston, in hex 0610. This matter requires investigation.'

relationships.description: The Archdeacon consults with the Order on undead matters
relationships.notes: They coordinate efforts against supernatural threats

faction_hooks.description: Investigate the rumored undead plague around the ruins of Lankston

entries.description: 2 dandies (Level 1 knights—DMB) duel in a square.
2d4 town guards arresting 1d4 shorthorns (DMB) on false claims of smuggling, demanding a hefty bribe.
2 griffons (DMB) shriek in battle above the Griffonry.
